intro: Oldenlandia attenuata, commonly known as the slender spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous annual or perennial, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its slender stems are usually covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, showy white or pink flowers. The leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and often have a hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive botanical appearance.
